content.description: Start with your right hand on a sloping hold on the arête and a left on a small crimp pinch. Climb up the arête.
content.location: west side of the Beer Bong Boulders

content.description: Had to clean of some very loose rock to make this climbable.  Sit start on good holds on the right side of the west face of the boulders. Climb straight up on decent holds to a good top out.
content.location: right side of west face

content.description: Start on Full Downclimb and climb right using the crack. when the crack ends use crimps slightly down and continuing right thru the crux. Continue right to a long angling crimp rail and finish on the far right of the boulder.
content.protection: ummm.....don't fall.  this climb wouldn't be easy to use pads, and a fall could be bad because the gab below.
content.location: entire east face.

content.description: Start on the west face of the taller boulder on a right hand crimp and a left under cling on a flake. Make hard moves off the "teeth" holds to a good jug at the top. The 1st move to the very small tooth is the first of the cruxes. The second crux is holding the two finger tooth and making the throw for the jugs.
content.location: west face of taller boulder

content.description: Start on a funky sloper bulge feature and climb up on a few good holds to a grainy top out.
content.location: right side of south face.

content.description: Start on the west face on the left side of the slab and climb up.
content.location: west side of Beer Bong boulders

content.description: Start as the same as Long and Hard, go strait up on microscopic crimps and bullets hole dishes to the top, currently a working project, at the least a V8, i need someone to send.
content.location: Overhangin face on Bouder that faces North.  Starts on very small crimp with 2 hands

content.description: Start on Hummingbird and make a huge move straight up to a crimp feature. Grab the hollow sounding jugs at the top and mantle.
content.location: Same ans Hummingbird

content.description: Start as Beer Bong Layback but climb up and left on smaller holds.
content.location: east face of Beer Bong Boulder. Start as BB layback.

content.description: The sit start to Teeth of Justice.  Sit start on a left hand crimp in a crack and a very bad right hand small sloping dish. Make super difficult moves thru the start of Teeth of Justice and finish it up. GREAT SEQUENCE!!!
content.location: Southwest face of east Beer Bong boulder

content.description: Chimminey your way out of the the boulder.  Fun to do.
content.protection: Crash pad, if you can get it in the cave
content.location: Go Around the back of the boulder and go inside the cave, climb chimminey to the top of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the large left facing jug and make cool moves out the overhanging prow to a big sloper. Make the big crux move with your right hand to a small horn and exit up and slightly left.
content.location: obvious overhanging prow on the NE corner of the larger of the two main boulders in the cluster.

content.description: Start on a left and crimp/jug and a right hand crimp. stand onto the grainy slab.
content.protection: N/A rock behind you. DON'T FALL!!
content.location: NW corner pf BBB

content.description: Start on a good sloper right and a good left hold on the slab behind the down climb.
content.location: behind the downclimb

content.description: Start on the far left end of the horizontal crack. Follow the crack right for a few moves then continue up the crack to the top of the rock on good holds.
content.protection: pad but it won't help much
content.location: far left end of the east side of the Beer Bong Boulders

content.description: Start and climb Hummingbird to the sloping jug. Make the big crux move to the small horn with your with your LEFT hand. Continue right for a couple moves and mantle.
content.location: Same as Hummingbird

content.description: SS on a right leaning overhanging arête. Make a few fun moves to a slopper around the corner and top out.
content.location: overhanging rock next to The Hummingbird.

content.description: This is also the down climb for these boulders. Start on a low good crimp below the crack leading to the top. climb on good hold to the top. Beware of the bad fall.
content.location: On the east face of the beer bong boulders with a low angle slab behind you.

content.description: Start on good holds to the left of Grungy Slab. Climb the slab on hollow sounding crimps.
content.location: NW corner of BBB

content.description: Start on the Starting jugs in the horizontal crack on Full Downclimb.  Climb straight up making committing moves off of two crimps to the good top-out.
content.location: Southeast corner of east boulder in the area.

content.description: The stand start to Commador 64. Start at 5' on opposing arrets.
content.location: South face of west boulder

content.description: Sit start on low opposing arrets and slap your way up to a goo top out.  Don't touch the boulder to the right.
content.location: To the right on Westright

content.description: climb the off-width crack t the right of Commador 64
content.location: south side of Beer Bong Boulder

content.description: Stand up on a bulge to the left of the start of Hummingbird. gain the slab and right angling cring rail to the top and mantle.
content.location: east side of Beer Bong Boulders left of Hummingbird

content.description: Climb Full Downclimb to the lip and traverse the lip to the right. Traverse right for about 25' till you are standing on the big sloper on Hummingbird and top-out.
content.protection: This would be very difficult to protect. Best to just not fall on this one.
content.location: Southeast corner of Beer Bong boulder.

content.description: Start on a big left facing crack/sidepull system 15 feet right of Downclimb. Climb up the lay back to a sketchy top out on hollow holds with a bad fall.
content.protection: pad but it won't help much
content.location: Far right side of Beer Bong Boulders

content.description: Mostly north facing boulder.  One of the first boulders to be established in the area.  Took lots of cleaning and and hard work to get some climbs on this one.  Many of them are V3 and above.  Climbs here are super thin and vertical to slightly overhung granite.  There is a possible V10+ line on here I wont even touch.  Many different routes here, slopers and mainly crimps, lots of variety.  BIGGER THAN PENCIL THIN BOULDER OR WILEY THOMSON.
